item.title: Hegseth authorizes 2,000 National Guard troops to carry weapons in DC if necessary: US official
item.description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth has authorized National Guard soldiers and airmen to carry arms in D.C. if their mission requires it. This comes amid a...

item.title: Longtime Trump ally Gruters expected to succeed Whatley as Republican Party chair
item.description: RNC chair Michael Whatley steps down to run for Senate in North Carolina as Trump-endorsed Joe Gruters takes over leading the Republican National Comm...

item.title: Navy sailor faces life in prison after selling military secrets to China for $12K payment
item.description: A Navy sailor faces life in prison after his conviction for selling sensitive military information about USS Essex weapons systems to China for cash.

item.title: Top Trump agency slashes billions in government waste with move to expose 'abuse' of US tax dollars
item.description: DHS Secretary Kristi Noem personally reviews contracts over $100,000, saving taxpayers $12 billion in 200 days through streamlined approval processes.

item.title: Jillian Michaels accuses CNN of 'lying,' 'smearing' her after viral slavery debate
